d0.domanda: Introduction to the calculus of variations: minimum and minimum points

d1.domanda: Indirect method in the calculus of variations: first variation of a function along a curve, Gateaux derivative, necessary conditions for minimality

d2.domanda: Direct method in the calculus of variations: notion of convergence, compactness, lower semicontinuity, coercivity, Weierstrass theorem

d4.domanda: First examples of application of the indirect method: explicit study of three model examples of integral functionals with Lagrangian depending on a power of the derivative

d5.domanda: Integral and differential forms of the first variation

d7.domanda: Fundamental Lemma in the Calculus of Variations (FLCV), FLCV with 0 average, Du Bois-Reymond Lemma (classical and Lebesgue setting): statements, possible strategies for the proofs, discussion of variants

d8.domanda: Genesis of boundary conditions for Euler-Lagrange equations

d9.domanda: Examples leading to conditions of Dirichlet, Neumann, and periodic type

d11.domanda: Euler-Lagrange equation for a general Lagrangian: integral forms, differential forms (classical, à la Du Bois-Reymond, Beltrami identity for the autonomous case)

d12.domanda: Discussion of the regularity assumptions needed for each form

d13.domanda: Extension to Lagrangians depending on higher order derivatives

d14.domanda: First variation of functionals with multiple integrals: Dirichlet integral and Laplacial, Euler-Lagrange equation in divergence form, normal derivative and Neumann boundary conditions

d15.domanda: Sufficient conditions for minimality: via convexity and via auxiliary osculating functional

d16.domanda: Existence and nonexistence of minima in the case of a nonconvex Lagrangian (double-well potential)

d17.domanda: Inner (horizontal) variation of an integral functional

d18.domanda: Truncation argument for functionals vs maximum principles for corresponding Euler-Lagrange equations

d20.domanda: Strong continuity of the norm and the scalar product

d22.domanda: Every Hilbert space admits a Hilbert basis (finite or countable if the space is separable)

d23.domanda: Components of a vector with respect to a Hilbert basis

d24.domanda: Representation of vectors, norm, and scalar product in terms of components

d25.domanda: Proof of the two main results concerning Hilbert bases

d26.domanda: Weak convergence in Hilbert spaces: definition, first properties, first examples

d27.domanda: For bounded sequences, weak convergence is equivalent to convergence of components with respect to a Hilbert basis

d28.domanda: Passing a scalar product to the limit with a weak and a strong convergence

d29.domanda: Lower semicontinuity of the norm with respect to weak convergence in a Hilbert space

d30.domanda: Weak compactness of balls is a separable Hilbert space

d31.domanda: Normal convergence of series in Banach spaces

d32.domanda: L2 and l2 as Hilbert spaces

d33.domanda: Road map to the completeness of L2 spaces

d34.domanda: Elementary proof of the completeness of l2

d35.domanda: Example of a sequence of functions that converges weakly but not strongly in L2

d37.domanda: First properties: uniqueness, linearity, compatibility with the classical case, examples of existence and non-existence

d38.domanda: Stability when passing to the limit

d39.domanda: A function coincides almost everywhere with the integral function of its W-weak derivative

d40.domanda: Continuity of functions with a W-weak derivative

d43.domanda: Definition (W and H) of Sobolev spaces (of order 1 in an interval)

d44.domanda: Holder continuity of Sobolev functions with p>1

d45.domanda: Pointwise values of Sobolev functions (up to the boundary)

d46.domanda: W implies H (for both weak derivatives and Sobolev spaces)

d48.domanda: Integration by parts formula for Sobolev functions

d49.domanda: Road map of the direct method: weak formulation in Sobolev spaces, compacteness with respect to a suitable notion of convergence, lower semicontinuity with respect to the same notion of convergence, regularity (weak form of ELE, from H1 to C1 and C2, bootstrap)

d51.domanda: Further examples of application of the direct method

d52.domanda: Estimates from below on the Lagrangian and DBC vs integral estimates on derivatives

d53.domanda: Uniform estimates on functions obtained from integral estimates (through the mean value theorem for integrals)

d55.domanda: Variational approach to a boundary value problem for an ordinary differential equation of order two: existence, regularity, uniqueness under monotonicity/convexity assumptions (two proofs: via uniqueness for the associated minimum problem, and via the equation itself), qualitative behavior of the solution

d56.domanda: How to adapt the variational approach to different boundary conditions of Dirichlet/Neumann type

d57.domanda: Definition of weak convergence in Lp

d58.domanda: If the measure of the space is finite, then the weak convergence in L1 is the weakest

d59.domanda: For bounded sequences it is enough to test weak convergence on a set of test functions whose span is dense

d60.domanda: Boundedness in Lp and weak convergence in L1 imply weak convergence in Lp

d61.domanda: Monotone approximation lemma for convex functions

d62.domanda: Lower semicontinuity of integral funzionals with respect to weak convergence under convexity assumption

d63.domanda: Weak compactness of balls in Lp for p>1

d65.domanda: General weak compactness statement in L1 with boundedness of an integral with superlinear growth

d66.domanda: Proof of weak compactness of balls under additional assumptions

d67.domanda: Example of a minimum problem for a functional with non-quadratic growth in the derivative

d68.domanda: Optimal Holder regularity of the derivative of minimizers

d70.domanda: Characterization of the norms generated by a scalar product (Jordan-Fréchet-von Neumann)

d71.domanda: Projection onto a closed convex set: existence, uniqueness, characterization, 1-Lipschitz continuity

d72.domanda: Projection onto closed subspaces: linearity and characterization

d75.domanda: Strong separation (through hyperplanes) of a point and a closed convex set

d76.domanda: Strongly closed + convex implies weakly closed

d77.domanda: Strongly lower semicontinuous + convex implies weakly lower semicontinuous

d78.domanda: Lagrange multipliers method: statement in terms of first variation, and proof via inverse function theorem

d80.domanda: Dependence of the Poincaré constant on the length of the interval

d81.domanda: Final examples concerning integral functionals: variational approach to the existence of periodic solutions for an ordinary differential equation, competition between growth assumptions, study of a critical case using Poincaré inequality

d82.domanda: Weak derivatives: definition W and H, basic properties, H implies W, statement that W implies H

d83.domanda: Sobolev spaces in full generality (any dimension, any open set, any order of derivation): definition W and definition H (as the completion of a suitable metric space)

d84.domanda: Statement of the three approximation theorems: low cost version, Meyers-Serrin, deluxe version

d85.domanda: Example of function without first order weak-derivatives, but with second order mixed weak-derivatives

d86.domanda: Algebraic theorems in Sobolev spaces: product, composition (Sobolev inside), absolute value, min and max, composition (Sobolev outside)

d87.domanda: Discussion of the approximation results needed in the proof

d89.domanda: Summary of basic facts about mollifiers and regularization by convolution

d91.domanda: Proof of the low-cost approximation result for Sobolev functions

d92.domanda: Proof that W-weak derivatives are also H-weak derivatives

d93.domanda: The product of a Sobolev function and a C-infinity function with compact support is a Sobolev function

d94.domanda: Partitions of the unity of type A (locally finite covering of an open set by means of well-contained open sets)

d96.domanda: Embedding theorems for Sobolev spaces: statement of the three cases (depending on p and d), both in the whole space and in a regular open set, both for derivatives of order one and for derivatives of any order

d97.domanda: Pure (rhs depending on the gradient only) vs impure (rhs depending on the full norm) estimates

d98.domanda: Definition of various classes of extenders, and their role in the proof of Sobolev embeddings and deluxe approximation results

d99.domanda: Gagliardo inequality (with a hint to Brascamp-Lieb inequalities): statement and proof

d100.domanda: Homothety argument that identifies the exponents involved in the Sobolev embeddings

d101.domanda: First example of an open set where extension and embedding results fail

d102.domanda: Proof of Sobolev embeddings for p less than or equal to the space dimension

d103.domanda: Deluxe approximation for Sobolev functions on the whole space

d104.domanda: Proof of Sobolev embeddings into Holder continuous functions for p greater than the space dimension (Morrey)

d105.domanda: Sobolev functions with p greater than the space dimension vanish at infinity

d106.domanda: Scaling technique for constructing multi-bump counterexamples

d108.domanda: Extension by reflexion in cylinders, and computation of weak derivatives of the extension

d109.domanda: Extension in rectangles by multiple reflections

d110.domanda: Open sets with compact boundary of class C-1

d111.domanda: Sobolev spaces of diffeomorphic open sets are isomorphic

d112.domanda: Partitions of the unity of type B (finite covering of an open set with compact boundary)

d113.domanda: Existence of 1-extenders for open sets with compact boundary of class C-1

d114.domanda: Informal introduction to compact embedding theorems

d115.domanda: Summary of basic facts concerning compactness, relative compactness, and total boundedness in metric spaces

d116.domanda: Compactness criterion in Lp spaces (Lp variant of Ascoli-Arzelà theorem)

d117.domanda: Compact embedding theorem in Sobolev spaces (Rellich-Kondrachov): statement and proof

d118.domanda: Interpolation inequality in Lp spaces and consequences

d119.domanda: Counterexample to compact embedding in the critical case

d121.domanda: Traces of Sobolev functions in the model case (half-space): fundamental inequality in the smooth case, further Lp regularity, definition through approximation

d122.domanda: Basic properties of the trace: linearity, it coincides with the restriction for continuous functions, integration by parts formula

d124.domanda: Continuous dependence of the trace under a boundedness assumption on the gradients

d126.domanda: Road map for the definition of the trace in regular open sets

d127.domanda: Sobolev functions that can be approximated with functions of class C-infinity with compact support: definition, embedding theorems, characterization (in open sets with smooth boundary) as functions with null trace or functions whose extension by 0 is Sobolev

d128.domanda: Approximation of Sobolev functions defined in the complement of a single point by functions of class C-infinity with compact support

d129.domanda: Connection with the computation of the capacity of a point in a ball

d130.domanda: Discussion of the capacity in terms of the space dimension and the summability exponent p

d131.domanda: Poincaré-Sobolev inequalities (estimate of the q-norm of a function that is 0 at the boundary in terms of the p-norm of the gradient

d132.domanda: Poincaré-Sobolev-Wirtinger inequalities (estimate of the q-norm of the difference between a function and its average in terms of the q-norm of the gradient)

d133.domanda: Discussion of two possible strategies for a proof

d134.domanda: Example of variational approach to two elliptic equations: weak formulation, compactness, lower semicontinuity, existence of a weak solution via direct method, ELE in first integral form

d135.domanda: Introduction to regularity for elliptic equations

d136.domanda: Terminology: ellipticity condition on a matrix, linear/semilinear/quasilinear equations

d137.domanda: Summary of (internal and up-to-the-boundary) regularity results for linear elliptic equations: L2/Lp/Schauder theory

d139.domanda: Statement of the internal L2 regularity results

d140.domanda: A priori estimates for internal regularity, both in the whole space, and in a general open set

d141.domanda: Rigorous proof of the localization result (Laplacian of the product of a smooth and a Sobolev function)

d142.domanda: Discrete derivatives: definition and main properties

d143.domanda: Characterization of Sobolev spaces in terms of discrete derivatives

d144.domanda: From a priori estimates to elliptic regularity via discrete derivatives

d145.domanda: Regularity up to the boundary for elliptic equations with Dirichlet boundary conditions: a priori estimates in a half-space, formalization through discrete derivatives, general case in regular open sets

d147.domanda: Strong-strong continuity for linear compact operators

d148.domanda: Weak-strong continuity for compact symmetric linear operators

d151.domanda: Spectral theorem for compact symmetric linear operators

d152.domanda: Example of a linear symmetric operator without eigenvalues

d153.domanda: Uniform-on-bounded-sets limit of compact operators is compact

d154.domanda: Approximation of compact operators in Hilbert spaces

d156.domanda: From Brouwer fixed point theorem to Schauder fixed point theorem

d157.domanda: Counterexample to Brouwer fixed point theorem in infinite dimension

d159.domanda: Proof of existence of solutions for differential equations via Schauder fixed point theorem

d160.domanda: Characterizations of continuity for linear applications between normed spaces

d162.domanda: Discussion of the existence of continuous and non-continuous applications between normed spaces

d164.domanda: Space of linear operators between normed spaces

d166.domanda: Topological dual of a normed space

d169.domanda: Definition of weak convergence (in a normed space) and weak* convergence (in its topological dual)

d171.domanda: Weak* compactness of balls in duals of separable normed spaces

d172.domanda: Weak/strong separation through hyperplanes: definitions, statements, consequences (strong + convex implies weak)

d173.domanda: Pseudo-norm (gauge) associated to a convex set

d174.domanda: Proof of the results concerning weak/strong separation through hyperplanes (geometric forms of Hahn-Banach theorem)

d175.domanda: Example of two closed convex sets in finite dimension that do not admit a strong separation

d176.domanda: Description of common sequence spaces: lp, converging sequences, sequences whose limit is zero, sequences that are eventually zero

d178.domanda: Characterization of the dual of l1 and lp

d179.domanda: Dual of sequences whose limit is zero, of sequences that are eventually zero, and of converging sequences

d180.domanda: In the case of l-infinity the duality pairing with l1 is a non-surjective isometry

d181.domanda: Elements of the dual of l-infinity that coincide with the limit for converging sequences

d183.domanda: Dual of Lp spaces on finite measure spaces via Radon-Nikodym theorem: well-posedness, linearity, continuity, isometry, costruction of the measure

d184.domanda: Conclusion of the proof of the characterization of duals of Lp spaces

d185.domanda: Dual of Hilbert spaces: proof via orthonormal basis and via projection onto a closed convex set

d186.domanda: Bidual, canonical injection, and definition of reflexive space

d187.domanda: Weak compactness of balls in reflexive spaces whose topological dual is separable

d188.domanda: Realization of the sup in the definition of norm in the dual

d189.domanda: Relation between the separability of a space and the separability of its dual

d191.domanda: Representation theorems for duals vs weak compactness of balls in Lp

d192.domanda: Lax-Milgram approach to existence of weak solutions for linear elliptic equations

d193.domanda: Extenders of pointwise values as elements of the dual of L-infinity

d194.domanda: Examples of non-uniqueness of the aligned functional

d195.domanda: Baire spaces: equivalent definitions and basic terminology

d196.domanda: Complete metric spaces and locally compact topological spaces are Baire spaces

d197.domanda: Open subsets of Baire spaces are Baire spaces

d198.domanda: First example of application of Baire category

d200.domanda: The set of discontinuity points of a function between metric spaces is an F-sigma set

d201.domanda: Irrational real numbers are not an F-sigma set

d202.domanda: A function of two real variables that is separately continuous, and vanishes on a dense subset, is identically zero

d203.domanda: Sequences that converge weakly in Hilbert and normed spaces are bounded

d204.domanda: There do not exist Banach spaces with countable algebraic basis

d205.domanda: Finite dimensional subspaces of a normed space are closed

d206.domanda: Existence of continuous functions that are nowhere differentiable

d207.domanda: Banach-Steinhaus theorem (as an equivalence and as an alternative)

d208.domanda: The pointwise limit of linear continuous operators is linear and continuous

d209.domanda: Proof of both versions of Banach-Steinhaus theorem

d210.domanda: Existence of a dense G-delta set of continuous and periodic functions whose Fourier series does not converge in a dense G-delta set of points

d211.domanda: Characterization of surjective mappings in terms of qualitative solvers

d212.domanda: Existence of linear qualitative solvers for surjective linear maps

d213.domanda: Characterization of open mappings in terms of quantitative solvers

d214.domanda: Statement of the open mapping theorem

d215.domanda: Corollaries: continuity of the inverse, equivalence of Banach norms, closed graph theorem

d216.domanda: Proof of the open mapping theorem

d217.domanda: In a normed space every vector is the sum of an absolutely converging series with values in a dense subset

d218.domanda: Quantitative solvability on the whole space vs quantitative solvability on a dense subset

d219.domanda: Existence of a linear quantitative solver vs existence of a topological complement

d221.domanda: The pointwise limit of continuous functions is continuous in a dense G-delta set

d222.domanda: The derivative of a differentiable function is continuous in a dense G-delta set

d225.domanda: The inverse of a symmetric compact operator as an unbounded multiplication operator

d227.domanda: Classical example of unbounded operator: second derivative (or Laplacian) with homogeneous Dirichlet boundary conditions

d228.domanda: Compactness and symmetry of the inverse in any dimension

d229.domanda: Computation of eigenvalues and eigenvectors in the one dimensional case

d230.domanda: Computation of the domain of the power 1/2 of the second derivative with Dirichlet boundary conditions in an interval

d231.domanda: Continuity of functions in the fractional Sobolev space Hs (in an interval) with s greater than 1/2

d232.domanda: Existence of unbounded functions in the fractional Sobolev space Hs with s less than 1/2

d233.domanda: Regularity of eigenfunctions of the Laplacian, and orthogonality of their gradients, in any space dimension

d234.domanda: In a square, traces of H1 functions coincide with functions of class H 1/2 of the section

d235.domanda: List of important arguments that have not been addressed in the course
